definition: To move from one side to the other, typically referring to crossing a physical barrier such as a road, river, or bridge. It is commonly used to describe the action of traversing or crossing over an obstacle or boundary.

examples.german: Der Fluss kann man nur mit einer Brücke überqueren.
examples.english: The river can only be crossed with a bridge.
The pedestrians cross the zebra crossing.

examples.german: Wir müssen die Grenze überqueren, um ins Nachbarland zu gelangen.
examples.english: We have to cross the border to get to the neighboring country.
The hiking trail crosses the mountain pass.
